item.title: Loads of dumped flytipped road work equipment, 9th June
item.description:
Iâ€™ve just driven along this stretch of road, and frankly, the state of it is shocking. The amount of litter and fly-tipping lining the verges and central reservation for miles is unacceptable. It resembles conditions youâ€™d expect in a neglected area, not on a major UK roadway. Whatâ€™s even more frustrating is that your own maintenance teams appear to be adding to the mess â€” with abandoned roadwork equipment, metal frames, cones, and sandbags scattered everywhere. Itâ€™s hard to believe this is being allowed to continue unchecked. You should be genuinely ashamed. This level of disregard for the environment and public space is simply indefensible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Circular Road, Hale End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Footpath totally overgrown AGAIN (upper east side), 9th June
item.description:
7440580 see report from April 25, which is put as FIXED 7th May - I have doubts that any cutting back was done at all! You really must cut back and clear the footpaths properly twice a yr. Point proven, mother and two children from Mayplace came along the path, I had to literally stand in a bramble so they could squeeze past. I have an injury to my arm from scratches and nettles. This is footpath for schoolchildren!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakwood Drive, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
